physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Diffuse but quiescent nonscarring alopecia; hyperpigmented patches on the lower lip; scattered scaly, erythematous, discoid lesions on the face and neck; hyperkeratotic plaques on the elbows; plantar surfaces of the feet covered with erythematous plaques and thick, hyperkeratotic scale; soles extremely swollen with marked tenderness to light palpation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Three weeks later, minimal improvement in the lesions. Four months later, only a few clearing discoid lesions on the cheeks, arms, and plantar surfaces of the feet remained.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Extensive erythematous, scaly plaques of clearing discoid lupus erythematosus (DLE) on the scalp, ears, and neck; erythematous, scaly, atrophic patches and plaques on the dorsal and palmar surfaces of both hands.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Three months later, lesions on both dorsal and palmar surfaces of the hands showed marked improvement.
